text: Admiral Sir John Devereux Treacher (23 September 1924 â€“ 30 April 2018) was a British naval officer. He served as Commander-in-Chief Fleet from 1975 to 1977. In retirement he became Chief Executive of National Car Parks. He was also Deputy Chairman of Westland Group and a Director of Meggitt. He was named chairman of London's Playboy Club in an attempt to secure a gambling license that had been denied over concerns regarding his predecessor.New York Times October 6,1981 Treacher died on 30 April 2018 at the age of 93. == References == Category:1924 births Category:2018 deaths Category:British businesspeople Category:British military personnel of World War II
title: John Treacher
